text: the Corbusier was explaining the use of
concrete in his buildings and he used
the words raw concrete bet on brute
it was then re-appropriated by a
journalist called Reyner Banham and he
kind of phrase the new brutalist what
makes a brutalist building work if you
say to somebody what we're just going to
use concrete that's it
it sounds dreadful dull ugly but they're
not what makes them work it's a sense of
place it's a sense of the drama of the
space that they surround my interesting
Brutalism really took off when I moved
to East London in about 99 it's almost
like they would like spaceship like
within their environment and I once
likened brutalist buildings playground
bullies in this sense of place and their
sense of commanding and environment -
one of the reasons for the book was that
we wanted to look beyond just concrete
and look at of buildings of mass of
strong silhouettes and strong presence
the whole project that I started was
launched on social media - 2014 via a
Twitter feed I was surprised how many
people out there with had the same taste
it is sculpture it's gone beyond being
just functions is this beautiful
sculpture that mirrors its environment
